reviews.review_msg: Bus238 is the most difficult course I've ever taken. The material is a joke, I had three pages of class notes by the end of term - but 70% of your mark is in group projects or shadowing assignments. Your mark is barely based on your own merits. The professor is helpful, enthusiastic and friendly but the class itself is terrible. Do NOT take it.

Pretty unorganized, would say weird things and then blame the fact that its an 8:30 class. Projects were vague and then she took marks off for not including things that were not mentioned in the project description in the first place. Constantly talks about her 0 waste cafe in Downtown Vancouver. Hates when people walk in late. Class was meh overal
Easy A

I took a lot from the course personally, but not academically. Lisa is wordy and unclear, her projects are on pre-determined unmovitational themes, and the exam was unethically handled where students were given all the time in the world until they felt they were ready. Take it for the credits, but grades aren't easy - so, don't take it.

I've been at SFU for 4 semesters so far and I can say she's the best prof I've ever had, hands down. Not the easiest marker but she's inspirational and really helpful. She's passionate about business and it's great talking to her about future opportunities and what not! She always offers help and I appreciate her detailed feedback on assignments :)

MSE 490 tech E: Kate is very nice and really cares about the class. Will try to get as involved as she can with whatever you are doing. Great person, she likes to talk but I don't mind that at all as its part of what makes her good. Any class you can take with this Lady you gotta, she'll do as good as she can for whatever she teaches. Shoutout Kate

Instructor Kate helped me finally internalize key lessons of entrepreneurship that I never understood before (e.g. relationships are the most valuable thing an entrepreneur builds).

She has many stories; the focus of the class is on actual innovation; and she loves to connect people.

Her lectures can seem disorganized but contain many gems.
she was great! nicest prof I've ever had, she made me want to do the business innovation certificate.

Kate gives everything to her students, and is one of the most responsive professors I've ever had. From bringing food in on multiple occasions, to bringing in Industry professionals, Kate's class changed my life. The people she would bring in -- successful alumni from previous years -- were testaments to a success we as students could achieve.
Best prof ever!!

Kate is an amazing prof! She has changed my life and is by far the most helpful and kind prof I have ever met. She treated everyone well and gave her 110% to every class and every student she taught. The course itself is very group based with only about 20 or 30% being individual. I recommend this course for non-business student due to the prof.

Simon is hands down the best prof I've had at SFU. He is extremely well spoken and consistently makes lectures engaging and interactive. If you're looking for a business elective which rewards active participation and engagement, I highly recommend taking BUS 238 with him!

The best professor I've had at SFU. Lectures were engaging and inspiring, and I learned so much from both Simon and the guest speakers he brought in. Simon knew everyone's name and encouraged every student to branch out and make connections with classmates. I enjoyed the projects we had and I'd 100% recommend any course with him.

An absolutely amazing professor. I can confidently say Dr. Ford has been the best prof I've had at SFU. The case competition was extremely fun, and I thoroughly enjoyed my overall experience in the course because of Dr. Ford.

Dr. Ford is the best prof at SFU. He is an amazing instructor, kind, helpful and will always want the best for each of his students. Even if you are not a business student, take this class!! It was a great way to learn about skills that can be used in every major. Excellent experience and will always wish him the best
Great instructor and lots of feedback if you ask for it. Class is very heavy on group projects so be careful of those not getting their work done. Would take as many classes as you can from him.

Really enjoyed taking Bus 238 with Professor Ford. I would highly recommend taking a class with him if you have the opportunity. Workload was reasonable for a 200 level class with lots of group work involved. He makes sure you get feedback from your teammates which is really good if you want to improve in the future. His lectures are really fun!

One of the best profs I have ever had. Simon is so inspiring and is passionate about everything he teaches in his lectures. I did not expect the class to be as difficult as it was, it definitely required a ton of work but it was also very rewarding and practical. Taking a class with Simon is amazing but not easy!!

Very enthusiastic, empathetic, and kind. Fun to listen to, and is open to engagement. Assignments can be tough to agree with, and it doesnt always work to plan. I wish there was even more freedom for creativity. Good prof, but perhaps because of how the class is designed, it didnt capture entrepreneurship. Still a good experience.

Simon is the best prof I've had at SFU so far. His class is the FIRST business course that actually makes me want to go to class, and the course content in general is very practical, and you learn a lot about businesses. He really wants to help students, makes sure he is available outside of class, and gives back meaningful feedback. Humble too!

Great prof. Simon really cares about his students and knows most by name (all by 4th week). Grading is straightforward, and he always expects you to challenge the assumptions. He is definitely my favourite prof :)
AMAZING PROFESSOR!! His class was fun and he explains everything very well. if you don't mind group projects then this class is a easy A!

I don't really get the hateful feedback for Katty in some of these reviews. She's an amazing prof and the classes are very interesting. The course is reliant heavily on group projects, so a bad group can be bad for your grade, but in most cases, it was fine.
I'd take more classes with Katty.
Great professor, very engaging lectures and assignments. Truly cares about students and accommodating for any issues.

Katty is the best possible professor for BUS 238. The lectures and assignments were crystal clear, and there were no stupid restrictions on assignments. She is very accommodating and caring, and very accessible via emails and office hours. I had an amazing experience in this class.
Amazing class and professor. Interesting lectures, and fair grading.
Prof. Wang is an amazing prof!

Katty is an amazing professor! The lectures were great, and she kept things interesting with real-world examples from her personal experiences, SFU Alumni stories, and other interesting stories. The grading was very clear and fair. She's very welcoming during office hours and hears the students about issues or conflicts.
I'd highly recommend it.

Group project based course, exams were only weighed for 25% of final grade. Content was light. Less emphasis on memorization and more emphasis on doing things outside the classroom. Really eye opening class in terms of questioning who you are as an individual and learning about yourself.
Best business prof. I've had at SFU. He brings practical and real business experience into the classroom.

Amyn is a professor with real-world experience with startups and businesses and deeply cares about sharing his experience by simulating real-world business environments with his class. Be prepared to engage in group work and formulate a creative business model while directly implementing what you learn in (sometimes tedious) class to your projects.
